Comment: VOTE - Overflow Room for additional public viewing at 250 Broadway.

Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
INVOCATION - Delivered by Pastor Ben Hur, Senior Pastor who serves as a spiritual leader at the Promise Church & Ministries International, located at 130-30 31st Ave, Flushing, NY 11354.

Motion to spread the Invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Koo.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Pastor Ben Hur, Senior Pastor who serves as a spiritual leader at the Promise Church & Ministries International, located at 130-30 31st Ave, Flushing, N.Y. 11354.

Council Member Koo moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the record.

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

Resolution calling on the New York City Department of Education to establish asynchronous learning programs at all Specialized High Schools and allow all New York City high school students to audit asynchronous learning program courses at Specialized High Schools provided that there is no undue burden imposed on teachers.

Items.MatterName: DOE to establish asynchronous learning programs at all Specialized High Schools.

Items.MinutesNote: The Majority Leader (Council Member Cumbo) presiding as the Acting President Pro Tempore

The presence of a quorum was announced by the Majority Leader and  Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo).

There were 43 Council Members marked present for this Stated Meeting held in the Council Chambers at City Hall, New York, N.Y.

At the time of this Stated Meeting, there were 2 vacancies in the Council (22nd District, Queens and 48th District, Brooklyn) pending the swearing-in of the respective certified winners of the November 2, 2021 General Election.

Items.MinutesNote: The Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo)  put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

The following files were removed from the General Order Calendar and voted separately:

Int. No. 339-B,  VOTE: 41-2-0
Negative: CM Yeger and the Minority Leader (Council Member Matteo).

Int. No. 2252-A,  VOTE: 41-2-0
Negative: CM Holden and the Minority Leader (Council Member Matteo).

Int. No. 2291,  VOTE: 42-1-0
Negative: CM Yeger.

Int. No. 2311-A,  VOTE: 35-6-2
Negative: CM Borelli, Holden, Miller, Ulrich, Yeger, and the Minority Leader (Matteo);
Abstention: CMS Brooks-Powers and Treyger.

Int. No. 2333-A, VOTE: 42-1-0
Negative: CM Borelli.

Int. No. 2335-A, VOTE: 42-1-0
Negative: CM Borelli

Int. No. 2356-A,  VOTE: 40-3-0
CMs Borelli, Yeger, and the Minority Leader (Council Member Matteo).

Int. No. 2359-A,  VOTE: 40-3-0
Negative: CMs Borelli, Yeger, and the Minority Leader (Council Member Matteo).

L.U. No. 819 & Res. No. 1719,  VOTE: 38-5-0
Negative: CMs Borelli, Holden, Ulrich, Yeger, and the Minority Leader (Council Member Matteo).

See files for individual votes.
At this point the Speaker (Council Member Johnson) made the following annoucements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Johnson), the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo) adjourned these proceedings to meet again for the Stated Meeting of Thursday, August 26, 2021.


MICHAEL McSWEENEY, City Clerk
Clerk of the Council
